result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:00 AM ADA Mark Fuhr calls case and states appearances. Defendant Katie L. Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared by video for Katie L. Baker.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Restemayer states bond modification request. Court makes comments. ADA Fuhr makes comments. Court grants request, bond is not being changed. Status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Order for Travel
Order for Travel
Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.

1:15 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Katie L. Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz  in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared in person for Katie L. Baker. Da Kelz states this matter is scheduled for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Restemayer states he is ready to proceed. DA Kelz calls witness Danielle Peterson the Jail administrator for Price County Jail.  Witness sworn. Direct questioning of the witness by DA Kelz. The witness identifies the defendant on record. Da Kelz presents Exhibit #1 to the witness. Exhibit marked. Identified and received by the court. No cross by Attorney Restemayer. Statement by DA Kelz. statement by Attorney Restemayer. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Attorney Restemayer would like to proceed to arraignment. Court addresses a Motion for Dismissal filed by Attorney Restemayer. Attorney Restemayer rescinds that motion due to the information being amended by the State. Attorney Restemayer requests a bond modification to allow his client to attend a court hearing in Indiana. DA Kelz makes comments. Court makes statements. Court states Atorney Restemayer  is to file an order addressing the temporary bond modification and the court will grant that request and sign it.

records.addlTxt: Scheduled for 06/09/2022 at 9:00 AM

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without permission from the court.

10:00 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Katie L. Baker appeared, in custody.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Katie L. Baker appeared by video means from Price County Jail.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. DA Kelz moves to quash the warrant and set bond. Court quashes the warrant and orders the bond as requested.   Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 06/09/2022 at 9:00 AM
